metadata.title: CVE-2021-22191 on Ubuntu Pro FIPS-updates 22.04 LTS (jammy) - medium
metadata.description:
Improper URL handling in Wireshark 3.4.0 to 3.4.3 and 3.2.0 to 3.2.11 couldallow remote code execution via via packet injection or crafted capturefile.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-22191` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libwireshark-data - 3.4.4-1ubuntu1
libwireshark14 - 3.4.4-1ubuntu1
libwiretap11 - 3.4.4-1ubuntu1
libwsutil12 - 3.4.4-1ubuntu1
tshark - 3.4.4-1ubuntu1
wireshark - 3.4.4-1ubuntu1
wireshark-common - 3.4.4-1ubuntu1
wireshark-gtk - 3.4.4-1ubuntu1
wireshark-qt - 3.4.4-1ubuntu1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: wireshark package in jammy, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '3.4.4-1ubuntu1').
